profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:21-0400

did.unittitle: Reports on papers read to the Académie royale des sciences, Paris, 1746
did.abstract: This volume contains reports made for the Académie des Inscriptions et Belles Lettres on such topics as astronomy, geometry, and natural history.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Table of contents (5 p.) available in the repository.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: French engineer and geometrician Étienne Mignot de Montigny served as the treasurer of France.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This manuscript collection falls outside the geographic scope of the Early American guide (British North America and the United States before 1840). It may be of interest to scholars interested in global history, international relations, imperialism, or the U.S. in the world.

controlaccess.famname: Courtivron, Gaspard Le Compasseur de Créqui-Montfort, -- marquis de, -- 1715-1785.
controlaccess.subject: Astronomy.
Beyond Early America
Electricity.
Geometry.
Natural history.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Institut de France. Academie des inscriptions et belle-lettres

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: Demontigny. 1vol.consisting of 240p.of which 216 contain writing. In French. Indexed in volume, and individually analyzed in catalogue.
